topic.title: Can I limit the amount of connections in ZeroNet ?
topic.body:
... via zeronet itself ? 

e.g. as shown in http://127.0.0.1:43110/Stats
"Connections (XX, total made: YYY):"

where XX has a limit

There are now 9 ZeroNet blogs (1) listed with people's impressions/ideas about ZN. 
I hope it inspires some of you to also start a blog of your own.

topic.title: I am lost in the loop, (a)mazing
Help testdrive MAIL@zeroverse please !
topic.body:
Today [mail@zeroverse](/mail.zeroverse.bit) was started.

[Here](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:52:explore+MAIL.zeroverse.bit) are some pictures and feature descriptions.

I'd appreciate when your try it out and provide feedback.

Thank you!

topic.title: Do you know articles, news about ZeroNet?
topic.body:
Would be great if you can share, so we can add them at:
[ZeroPress](/ZeroPress.bit)

topic.title: Our security in ZeroNet!
topic.body:
Hi,

please check [ZeroSecurity](/zerosecurity.bit) and suggest more/other issues/fixes to the list.

It includes a list of issues in general for ZeroNet, as well as for specific ZeroNet sites/apps.

Thanks!

topic.title: ZeroNet apps/sites that use encryption
topic.body:
Do you know ZeroNet apps/sites that encrypt data?

Let's increase the list: [ZeroEncryption](/zeroencryption.bit)

4_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf.body:
Just logged in at ZeroMail and got the "Successful registration!" mail.

Now I am waiting for/if echobot replies to me

Well, I see no message in both accounts.

I think it's better, to NOT USE IT with ZeroMail, until the admin looks at it.
I don't want to break ZeroMail :-(

But the other sites, like the [chat rooms](/zerochatrooms.bit) work nicely.

Yeah, when I enter erkan@something.com in the To:-field it gets deleted. 

I assume 
1. @ZeroVerse.bit has to be added there also in data/ZeroMail_hash/data/users/content.json (currently only zeroid is in the "cert_signers")
2. and then some new code(?) which allows email between different ID providers (from zeroid to zeroverse)
added now also a section "II. site admins: how to enable ZeroVerse.bit for your site"

bitmessage: you need it only once, for registering. After that, not anymore. 

Further tests with @kaffie and @doublec (thx to both of you) showed: 
that I as admin had to make changes on ZeroMedia.bit for them to edit with the new ID from ZeroVerse.bit
(see section "II. site admins: how to enable ZeroVerse.bit for your site" in my blog)

So, you can only use it where the site admins enable also ZeroVerse as ID provider.

BUT: to all of you, go ahead and test the new ID on the ZeroMedia.bit (where I as admin enabled access with the new ID)

We've optimized this more, and the tutorial has been detailed...

It's verified now that this new ID works with blogs and chats, see: http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:19:sites+which+support:+ID+@+ZeroVerse.bit

1_17d8biWB6b4QwDQ4zRHPRtZjcToMCyvjQD.body:
I can only speak for myself.
** **
For me it is a tool to be able to self-host. I used other tools to do that before (1). 
It can not replace the common net now, because it sits "on top of the net", it's not the net itself (cables, wlan, ...)
What people can do is build apps with it, that may replace other services from the clearnet, so our dependency on it gets less and less over time
** **
We also should all have an idea about how we want to share resources here (2). 
** **

And, btw, what are your ideas about what you ask us ?
** **
** **

** **
(1) http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:35:Do+I+miss+the+pre-ZeroNet+time+
(2) http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:37:Thoughts+about+ZeroNet+(opensource,+licence,+...)

10_17i7Y7r8nTaCfLbCAuaKyc4R5BbKZYU2Hr.body:
I like that @a4io5ziuf436y0df has thrown in ZeroMail :-)

There is [this](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/65) feature request: adding BitMessage support to ZeroMail.
And BitMessage can via gateways (1) receive/send "stinky-normal" emails with the outside world, from inside BM. 

So, you are "safe" as long as you are "inside BM/ZeroMail" over tor (and communicate with BM/ZM users). 
The gateway option is basically only for the transition period, 
because most likely not all your email contacts will follow you (at begin).
This should be in your mind when you communicate with the "normal emails".

btw: BM has also Thunderbird integration

More about ZeroMail's and BM's tech [here](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:30:ZeroMail+and+BitMessage+differences+)

** **

(1) I know 2 gateways, but they want money. But I am sure the gateway can also be done via self-host way

6_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf.body:
> @basxto: Switching users is buggy

Yes, no risk to lose one's identity anymore. With ZeroVerse one can now **easily switch** one's persona. Also, previous "solutions" required that one had to close the running ZN first.

>@ax: The same goes with the Zeroverse ID, what is the advantage in having two ID systems?

1. "The reason is most likely, because people don't know "the fact that ZeroID goes outside should be properly disclosed on the page. (Especially if it's by design)" (1) 
ZeroVerse is FORCING users to NOT **leak** their info (and also informing them **why** (2))." (written [here](/1K28kQFMquNzto2iQf4GGjr6oFUbC1NddE/?Poll:3-1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf))

2. **anonymity**
"Votes are tied to your ZeroID, they are pseudonymous, not anonymous. With a little bit of work someone can find out what you (your ZeroID) voted for." (see ZeroPolls' top message)
Currently, with a few sql commands, I can make a profile of each voter at ZeroPoll and extrapolate info from this.
But soon "you can make a throwaway account for doing things (like voting here) that you don't want tied to your main account" (written [here](/1K28kQFMquNzto2iQf4GGjr6oFUbC1NddE/?Poll:3-1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf))



mail.zeroverse.bit

Before announcing it to the public I've talked with @nofish (the admin of ZeroMail) about a "clone". My idea was actually, to include ZeroVerse in ZeroMail, but he said:
"I think a separate ZeroMail clone is a better idea currently".


> @ax: Correct me if I am wrong but isn't Zeromail already a distributed service/system? There is no hierarchy in nodes as far as I'm aware, we the nodes ARE Zeromail. Having everyone using Zeromail helps with providing cover traffic/plausible deniability.

Currently all ZeroNet sites have 1 problem: they have a **"powerful" admin**. There are different reasons why e.g. Mr. Murphy (or staff of 3-letter agencies, ...) can visit them, or not. But when he does and a sitePublish is done, data is manipulated/lost. All other nodes will update their versions when the central node tells it.

When people want to go elsewhere in the ZN network, they have to start with a fresh mailbox. Their **data** does not walk with them automatically. It's kept in the "big silo".
See [this picture](http://i.imgur.com/UVp8Hr9.jpg): when I see the current mail systems it looks to me like A: centralized. 
e.g. it is not like this that everyone can set up their own email-server (barack@obama.com) and communicate with others (michelle@thebestwife.com)
But mail.zeroverse.com does allow at least now: 
misterO@zeroid.bit can exchange emails with ladyM@zeroverse.bit

And people should not take the **storage size** lightly. I'm a power user, and I get hit all the time from the limits ([limit in ZeroMail](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:30:ZeroMail+and+BitMessage+differences+), in [chat](/zeroblog.bit/??Post:24:ZeroNet+apps+have+a+max+limit+for+user+contributions+%28Content+sign+failed:+invalid+private+key%29))
Probably only a few of you can imagine how it feels right now, to not play Goethe (a la: Sorry, I need more time with my reply, because I have to perfect it with less. In this case: hm, which email should I delete now?)

When I delete mails, they get **also deleted** on the receiver side, which is - well... 
you decide if that's good or not. At least it is confusing.

status after 4 weeks:

- 139 accounts
- 76% use zeroID
- liked most: de-centralization, anonymity/privacy

read more [here](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:70:after+4+weeks:+mail@zeroverse)

8_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf.body:
> @someperson Is any of this relevant when running ZeroNet through Tor?

Yes.

Also, see my comments about Tor (and its weaknesses in the note (B)).

** **
Question: if Tor would be the saviour to some of those issues, 
why does zeronet.py not **force** its users to **only run with tor** ?
E.g. for ZeroBundle users: tor could be included. The security of the ZeroNet users should have prio, always.
** **
@vlad20012 thank you, for reporting this into the bugtracker

> @musickiller hey, what about using ZN with Tor browser? This way all the plugins that are left alive, will transmit wrong IP! Ta-da, problem with IP solved, no fake proxy needed and all clearnet stuff is available!! =D


If they can transmit IP, then they can transmit also OTHER INFO about you, easily.

** **
I don't want to fully audit each ZN site first, just because I allow clearnet access for them.
I block clearnet access first (G001): 
if something doesn't work, I will see what it tried to send to elsewhere (where also others spy on, not only the site admin, in the worst case).
** **
And as stated in G013: 
a site admin can also change the code easily - for let's say 1h (A) - and revert back to the original code (B). 
You won't know that, except you do regular backups for each site via cron.
Anyways, your ZN client - an obedient slave - is set up so, that it will update at (A) and (B), 
and God alone knows what it has done/sent in that time...

So, one of the best things to do is:
clone the apps, but also be prepared to [merge new stuff in the future](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:4:imagine+you+have+a+known+bug+in+your+cloned+ZeroNet+app...)

> @vlad20012 #331 just closed

Great, moved G006 to the archive.
Thanks @nofish
